title: What is the purpose of the <canvas> element?
content: Explain how <canvas> can be used for rendering graphics on the fly.
explanation: <canvas> provides a drawable region in HTML. Using JS, you can draw shapes, images, or animations dynamically on the client-side.
sampleAnswers: <canvas> provides a drawable region in HTML. Using JS, you can draw shapes, images, or animations dynamically on the client-side.

title: Explain the difference between <iframe> sandbox attributes.
content: How does sandboxing improve security when embedding external content?
explanation: The 'sandbox' attribute limits iframe capabilities. Examples: allow-scripts, allow-same-origin. It prevents untrusted content from running arbitrary scripts or accessing parent DOM.
sampleAnswers: The 'sandbox' attribute limits iframe capabilities. Examples: allow-scripts, allow-same-origin. It prevents untrusted content from running arbitrary scripts or accessing parent DOM.

title: What is the difference between <audio> and <video> elements?
content: Include examples of controls, autoplay, and loop attributes.
explanation: <audio src='song.mp3' controls autoplay loop></audio> for audio. <video src='video.mp4' controls autoplay loop></video> for video. <video> has visual playback, <audio> is audio-only.
sampleAnswers: <audio src='song.mp3' controls autoplay loop></audio> for audio. <video src='video.mp4' controls autoplay loop></video> for video. <video> has visual playback, <audio> is audio-only.

title: How does the <meta> viewport tag affect mobile rendering?
content: Explain why <meta name='viewport' content='width=device-width, initial-scale=1'> is important.
explanation: It sets the width of the viewport to the device width and initial zoom. Without it, mobile browsers may scale desktop layouts incorrectly.
sampleAnswers: It sets the width of the viewport to the device width and initial zoom. Without it, mobile browsers may scale desktop layouts incorrectly.

title: What is the difference between <section> and <div>?
content: When should each be used semantically?
explanation: <div> is a generic container with no semantic meaning. <section> represents a thematic grouping of content. Use <section> when content has a specific topic.
sampleAnswers: <div> is a generic container with no semantic meaning. <section> represents a thematic grouping of content. Use <section> when content has a specific topic.

title: Explain the purpose of the <link rel='preload'> tag.
content: How does preloading resources improve performance?
explanation: <link rel='preload' href='script.js' as='script'> tells the browser to fetch resources early, reducing blocking and improving page load times.
sampleAnswers: <link rel='preload' href='script.js' as='script'> tells the browser to fetch resources early, reducing blocking and improving page load times.

title: How does <iframe> differ from <object> for embedding content?
content: Discuss pros and cons of both.
explanation: <iframe> embeds another HTML page, isolating it from parent. <object> can embed any resource (SVG, PDF) and interacts more with the parent. iframe is safer; object is flexible.
sampleAnswers: <iframe> embeds another HTML page, isolating it from parent. <object> can embed any resource (SVG, PDF) and interacts more with the parent. iframe is safer; object is flexible.

title: What is the difference between <col> and <colgroup>?
content: How are these used in table styling?
explanation: <col> applies styles to a single column. <colgroup> groups columns and applies collective styling or attributes.
sampleAnswers: <col> applies styles to a single column. <colgroup> groups columns and applies collective styling or attributes.

title: Explain how the 'autofocus' attribute works in forms.
content: Can multiple inputs have autofocus at the same time?
explanation: 'autofocus' makes a form element focus automatically on page load. Only the first element with autofocus receives focus if multiple are set.
sampleAnswers: 'autofocus' makes a form element focus automatically on page load. Only the first element with autofocus receives focus if multiple are set.

title: How do you create a semantic breadcrumb navigation in HTML5?
content: What elements and ARIA roles would you use?

title: What is the difference between <abbr> and <acronym>?
explanation: <abbr> is the HTML5-compliant tag for abbreviations with a title attribute. <acronym> is obsolete and should not be used.
sampleAnswers: <abbr> is the HTML5-compliant tag for abbreviations with a title attribute. <acronym> is obsolete and should not be used.

title: How does the 'required' attribute work on HTML5 forms?
content: Can it be bypassed? Explain with examples.
explanation: 'required' prevents form submission if the input is empty. It can be bypassed by JS or non-compliant browsers, so server-side validation is still needed.
sampleAnswers: 'required' prevents form submission if the input is empty. It can be bypassed by JS or non-compliant browsers, so server-side validation is still needed.

title: What is the purpose of the 'download' attribute on <a> tags?
content: Provide an example of forcing file download.
explanation: Download forces the browser to download the file instead of navigating to it.
sampleAnswers: Download forces the browser to download the file instead of navigating to it.

title: Explain how to make an element focusable with tabindex.
content: What are the differences between tabindex='0', '-1', and positive numbers?
explanation: tabindex='0' allows element to receive focus in normal tab order. '-1' makes it focusable via JS but not tab. Positive numbers define explicit tab order (discouraged).
sampleAnswers: tabindex='0' allows element to receive focus in normal tab order. '-1' makes it focusable via JS but not tab. Positive numbers define explicit tab order (discouraged).

title: How do you embed SVG graphics directly in HTML?
content: Provide an example with inline SVG and describe advantages.
explanation: <svg width='100' height='100'> <circle cx='50' cy='50' r='40' stroke='black' stroke-width='3' fill='red' /> </svg>. Inline SVG can be styled with CSS and animated with JS.
sampleAnswers: <svg width='100' height='100'> <circle cx='50' cy='50' r='40' stroke='black' stroke-width='3' fill='red' /> </svg>. Inline SVG can be styled with CSS and animated with JS.
